alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN ALBANY COUNTY THROUGH 415 PM MDT... At 330 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Tie Siding, or 17 miles south of Laramie, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation and outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tie City Campground, Vedauwoo, Tie Siding, Pumpkin Vine, Vedauwoo Campground, Buford, Yellow Pine Campground and The Buttes. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 320 and 336. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
